item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Our website address is: http://dinosaurdaycare.local.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms

Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Who we share your data with

If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

Your contact information

Additional information

How we protect your data

What data breach procedures we have in place

What third parties we receive data from

What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data

Industry regulatory disclosure requirements

item.title: About-Us
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded:
Towards a smart & passionate generation

Respect is an attitude that shows up in behaviour. Respectful behaviours on the part of caregivers are demonstrated by treating young children as people when changing a diaper, communicating with them, and facilitating their growth, development and learning all the way through their preschool years until they enter Kindergarten.

 

We practice the “Three-R” Interaction. The 3R Interaction is Respectful, Responsive, Reciprocal. The interaction is Responsive (the caregiver pays attention), the responses are linked in a Reciprocal way (back and forth responses between caregiver and child) and the caregiver is Respectful by telling what she will do before she does it.

 

The benefits of PLAY are enormous and go far beyond developing skills and learning concepts. Play can be an avenue to early literacy skills. Play is where many paths to literacy come together and emerging understandings are integrated, practiced and tested in a safe environment. In play, you can find all aspects of the kinds of skills children need for the foundations of reading and writing. Play offers children opportunities that come from nowhere else. Through play, children get involved in open-ended exploration. They are not confined by rules, procedures, or outcomes. Children play, they make discoveries they might otherwise never make, they work on problems they make choices, and they find out what interests them. The way we Respond to young children at play by giving them freedom, by helping them pursue their special interests, and by providing resources may result in children gaining lifelong skills and interests in their adult lives.

 

Giving young children freedom to move is a concept we embrace. Play involves movement and if they cannot move freely, they cannot fully engage in play. Movement, from the first months of life is important for brain development. It is also important for cognitive development. Physical movement with young children is about learning—not just to use the body, but to use the brain as well.

 

The terms "Free Play and Exploration" we define as undirected but monitored activity play when children have choices to pursue their special interests without continual caregiver control or expected outcomes. Letting free play and exploration remain free is difficult for some adults once they recognize how important activity is for young children. Adults often want to set up specific adult-created activities with objectives and plans for a controlled outcome.

 

We urge those adults who want to create activities and objectives and lesson plans to appreciate what children gain from free play by observing them. You will see that given a safe, developmentally appropriate, and a rich environment, they create their own objectives and lessons, which are far more effective that those you set up in advance.

 

Our curriculum content considers age-appropriateness in all developmental areas of social, emotional, cognitive, language and physical with emphasis on promoting friendships and increasing feelings of self-worth.

 

All children have strengths as well as needs. Our common goal is the development of skills, attitudes, and behaviour that will allow children to deal effectively with the world in which they live.

©2021 - Dinosaur Daycare - Designed by C&K Agency

item.title: Our-Goals
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded:
Our goal is..

To provide a safe, secure, nurturing environment in which children will be cared for while away from home.

 

Our intent is to provide an environment which stimulates a child’s intellectual, physical, social, and emotional development and encourages each child to reach his/her full potential.

 

Our program is designed to meet the needs of the children and to encourage the development of a healthy self image, a sense of responsibility to oneself and others, self-discipline, and creativity.

 

Our goal is to develop a positive attitude toward learning and to increase each child’s feelings of self-worth and confidence and to encourage independence, while instilling respect for teachers, peers and the the environment.

 

We will try to meet the individual child’s needs of a balance between the active play and a quiet corner with books.

 

We will provide staff who will allow and recognize individual needs and serve as professionals and not mere babysitters.

 

We will make use of available resources within the community for the benefit of child and staff.

 

©2021 - Dinosaur Daycare - Designed by C&K Agency

item.title: Routine
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded:
Routines help infants and toddlers feel safe and secure in their environment. 

Young children gain an understanding of everyday events and procedures and learn what is expected of them as routines make their environment more predictable. 

Routines can also help infants and toddlers become more trusting of you as a caretaker if their routines are effective and they feel comfortable in the environment.

Early morning
  • 7:30 to 8:00am : Free play
  • 8:00 to 8:30am : Gym or outside
Morning pre-school program
  • 8:30 to 10am : Free play/arts and crafts
  • 10:00 to 10:30am : Wash up, bathroom, snack
  • 10:30 to 11:00am : Circle (songs, stories, puppets, music, etc)
  • 11:00 to 11:45am : Large muscle – outside or gym
  • 11:45 to 12pm : Wash up/bathroom
Midday
  • 12:00 to 12:30pm : Lunch
  • 12:30 to 12:45pm : Story-time
  • 12:45 to 3:00pm : Naptime for nappers
    • Or 12:45 to 2:00pm : Outside or quiet gym games
    • And 2:00 to 3:00pm : Free play back in the room
  • 3:00 to 3:30pm : Wash up, snack, library books
  • 3:30 to 4:00pm : Circle – songs and stories
Late day
  • 4:00 to 5:00pm : Outdoors or gym or indoor free play 
    5:00 to 5:30pm : Indoor free play outdoors 
    5:30pm : Closed

Please note that if it is rainy or too cold outside we provide indoor activities as a back up.

©2021 - Dinosaur Daycare - Designed by C&K Agency

      • 12:45 to 3:00pm : Naptime for nappers
        • Or 12:45 to 2:00pm : Outside or quiet gym games<\/span><\/li>
        • And 2:00 to 3:00pm : Free play back in the room<\/li><\/ul><\/li>
        • 3:00 to 3:30pm : Wash up, snack, library books<\/li>
        • 3:30 to 4:00pm : Circle \u2013 songs and stories<\/li><\/ul>","_id":"5ca52d3"},{"_id":"0e6d89f","tab_title":"Late day","tab_content":"
          • 4:00 to 5:00pm : Outdoors or gym or indoor free play\u00a0
            5:00 to 5:30pm : Indoor free play outdoors\u00a0
            5:30pm : Closed<\/li><\/ul>"}],"border_width":{"unit":"px","size":1,"sizes":[]},"space_between":{"unit":"px","size":10,"sizes":[]},"title_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"15","right":"15","bottom":"15","left":"15","isLinked":true},"icon_space":{"unit":"px","size":10,"sizes":[]},"content_typography_typography":"custom","content_typography_line_height":{"unit":"em","size":1.5,"sizes":[]},"content_typography_letter_spacing":{"unit":"px","size":1,"sizes":[]},"content_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"10","right":"10","bottom":"10","left":"10","isLinked":true},"__globals__":{"title_color":"globals\/colors?id=949a489","tab_active_color":"globals\/colors?id=6376d38","icon_active_color":""},"title_typography_typography":"custom","title_typography_font_family":"Roboto Slab","content_typography_font_family":"Roboto Slab"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"toggle"}],"isInner":false},{"id":"8a991fa","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":45.393000000000001},"elements":[{"id":"642bd1d3","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"id":191,"url":"http:\/\/dinosaurdaycare.local\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/02\/trex5.jpg"},"hide_mobile":"hidden-phone"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"image"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false},{"id":"64b10da","elType":"section","settings":[],"elements":[{"id":"84b6ea7","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":100,"_inline_size":null},"elements":[{"id":"4176d54","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"

item.title: Covid-19
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded:
During the COVID-19 pandemic, Dinosaur Daycare and staff will follow and implement the necessary personal measures around our sickness policy suggested by the Ministry of Health/ BC Centre for Disease Control to prevent the transmission of COVID-19.

Before sending to childcare, parents must assess children daily for symptoms of:

  • Fever

  • Chills

  • Cough or worsening of cough

  • Breathing difficulties

  • Loss of smell or taste

  • Diarrhea

  • Nausea and vomiting

 

Staff must also assess the children daily for symptoms of:

  • Fever

  • Chills

  • Cough or worsening of cough

  • Breathing difficulties

  • Loss of smell or taste

  • Diarrhea

  • Nausea, vomiting

  • any other infectious respiratory disease

 

If your child has only one of the above symptoms without fever:

o   Children have to stay home, and parents are to monitor symptoms for 24 hours.

 

If your child has two or more of the above symptoms, has a fever or difficulty breathing:

o   Please call 8-1-1 for a health assessment

 

If a COVID-19 test is recommended, please self isolate.

 

Any child who arrives visibly ill will not be permitted to attend their childcare Centre.

Children may return to childcare once/if:

o   they are assessed by their family physician or nurse practitioner

o   it is determined that they do NOT have COVID-19

o   their symptoms have resolved.

 

If a child is found to be a confirmed case of COVID-19, Public Health will ensure that there is contact tracing and management of any clusters or outbreaks as well as ensure access to health care providers and support for families and staff.

HYGIENE/ HEALTH  & SAFETY PROCEDURES

During the COVID-19 pandemic, Dinosaur Daycare and our staff will follow and implement the necessary public health, environmental, administrative, and personal measures suggested by the Ministry of Health/ BC Centre for disease control/Local Fraser Health authority and MCFD to prevent and minimize the impact of infection and spread of novel COVID-19 virus.

 

ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE OF CHILDREN

  • Parents will always wear a facial covering while in the Centre, picking up and dropping off their children

  • Parents are to spray and disinfect keypad before entry (sanitation station is provided at the entry door)

  • Children will be dropped off at the door where a staff member wearing a face mask will greet them and guide them to their class (unless a guardian is needed to enter. Ie. new/younger children)

  • Floor will be marked for social distancing guidance for drop off and pick up

  • Staff will sign children in and out

  • Children are to wash their hands at arrival and departure

  • Staff will spray/disinfect the children’s shoes upon arrival

  • Children are to bring bedding for naps in a bag to be transferred into their nap cubbies)

  • Staff, children and parents are to avoid close greetings

  • Children will also be picked up at the door, so staff will ensure all children have their outdoor shoes on, washed their hands, have their belongings such as backpacks, jackets and water bottles with them.

 

HAND WASHING/SANITIZATION

  • Children will wash their hands throughout the day following hand washing protocols (ex. coming from outside the playground, before any eating time, after going to the rest room, sneezing, coughing, runny nose, etc.)

  • Use of an alcohol-based sanitizer will only be practiced when soap and water method is unavailable. If a child needs to use sanitizer, an adult/staff member must be physically present to observe and guide the child of proper use.

  • Children are to stay in their designated class to avoid cross contamination

  • Children will be allowed their water bottles, but they must be kept in their cubbies and taken home daily to be washed and disinfected.

 

ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE OF STAFF

  • Staff will always wear a facial covering:

    • while outside of their room/cohort

    • picking up and dropping off children at the door

    • communicating face to face with parents

  • Staff are to spray and disinfect hands before entry (sanitation station is provided at the entry door)

  • Staff are to wash their hands at arrival and departure (20 seconds. Refer to posted posters

  • Staff are to take their temperatures and sign their self-screening form

  • Staff are to bring and keep a pair of indoor shoes and change into them upon arrival

  • Staff, parents, and children are to avoid close greetings

 

SANITIZING AND DISINFECTING

  • Staff will change the PRE-empt/bleach solutions every other day or as needed

  • Staff will continue their daily cleaning routines, disinfecting high touch surfaces such as tables, shelves, chairs, toys, doorknobs/handles, light switches, faucets, and electronic devices, and telephone twice a day or as needed

  • Staff are to wash their hands throughout the day (ex. coming from outside the playground, before any eating time, after going to the rest room, sneezing, coughing, runny nose, etc.)

  • Staff will wash their hands after handling any garbage, cleaning tasks, facilitating a child toileting/diapering

  • Staff will use gloves when handling children’s food

  • One staff is to be designated for bathroom transition to dispense soap for the children

  • Napping cots are to be cleaned and disinfected daily (bedding linen must be taken home to be laundered. (Do not shake linens and parents must bring them in a bag to be transferred into their nap cubbies)

  • Staff and Janitorial services will do general cleaning and disinfecting once a day (air dry at the end of the day)

 

ENVIRONMENTAL/SOCIAL DISTANCING PROCEDURES

  • Staff and children are to avoid close greetings (Comfort is still expected to be given when children need it)

  • Children will be encouraged social/physical distancing through discussions, games and social stories

  • Staff will spread out activities to promote self-distancing the best they can

  • Use toys that encourage individual play

  • Outdoor time will be increased

  • Staff are encouraged to implement activities outdoors

  • During meals, staff are to accommodate 3-4 children per table (food is not to be shared)

  • During nap time, staff will arrange the beds as separated as possible (head –to- toe facing)

  • Staff are to encourage children of minimal physical contact with each other

  • Staff will remove plush toys

  • Staff will remove dress up costumes, wigs, and hats

  • Staff will eliminate sensory activities such as water play, slime, playdough (Unless its available for individual and one-time use)

  • If staff choose to include some sensory activities, each child will have their own tray and once sensory material is used, it will be thrown out and children are to wash their hands immediately

  • Staff will limit unnecessary trips to the kitchen, other rooms and office to avoid cross contamination

  • Staff will maintain distance from other staff

  • No visitors in the facility at all times (excluding consultants who will be screened before entering)

  • Cancel or postpone special events such as festivals, holiday events, and special performances.

During a time of pandemic, these policies and procedures supersedes those in our parent manual and agreements. Once the pandemic is declared over, we revert to regular policies and protocols.

©2021 - Dinosaur Daycare - Designed by C&K Agency

item.title: Additional-Info
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded:
Health

In case of emergency or accident, an ambulance/taxi may be called. Any expense incurred will be the parent responsibility. It is the parent responsibility, prior to registration to have alternate care arrangements in case of sickness. A sick child cannot be accepted at the center.

Medication

To comply with licensing regulations, prescribed medicine by a doctor will be administered to children only on receipt of completed signed medication form (available at center).

Food

An important part of the program is to encourage good eating habits by having nutritious lunches & snacks. The Parent supplies these meals so that their child receives a variety of healthy foods daily. Junk food, candy and gum are frowned upon. A microwave and fridge are available for everyday use.

Parents involvement

We have an Open-Door Policy which encourages parents to observe and visit as often as possible. Appointments are not necessary, however would be appreciated. The Parent Bulletin Board is our main method of written communcation. Individual Parent Meetings will be scheduled at the request of parents.

Birthdays

We celebrate at snack or lunch time with a Happy Birthday Song and a special Birthday Crown. Parents may provide a special treat if they wish. Cookies or Jello Jigglers are always a hit. Please do not send cake or cup cakes. Invitations to private birthday parties should be given to staff members who will discretely disperse the invitations to avoid hurt feelings of those not attending.

©2021 - Dinosaur Daycare - Designed by C&K Agency

item.title: Learning-Program
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded:
We have a panel of different activities and methods to develop your child

Art

A time to experience "the process…not the end product". A chance to be creative and manipulate various materials.

Table & Floor toys

Small muscle manipulation and eye-hand coordination. A time to share, take turns and socialize.

Blocks

Discovery of space & area and one to one relationships. Balance, weight relations, large and small muscle work and language stimulation.

Music

Fosters listening skills, creativity, self-expression, balance and body movement awareness. Experience and explore rhythm, beat, sounds and movement.

Sand

Pouring, measurement, space relations, science, social interactions, language stimulation. Relaxing and soothing.

Water

Soothing and relaxing activity providing social opportunities and language stimulation. Science, measuring, pouring and volume.

Circle time

A time to put things learned into practice, read stories, sing songs, watch puppets, learn to be in a group, develop listening skills. Learn pre- math skills such as counting and the calendar. Learn pre-reading skills by training eyes to go from left to right by way of felt stories and calendar.

Housekeeping

Fantasy and reality play. Role playing and a place to exlore and model our role in the world. Imagination and socialization.

Snack time

A social time and a chance for teachers and children to share their thoughts and learn about nutrition.

©2021 - Dinosaur Daycare - Designed by C&K Agency

item.content:encoded:
We offer you 2 different programs at Dinosaur Daycare

1 to 3 years old

Baby room 4 to 5 Days / week
  • 1 Child
  • 10 Hours daycare max
  • Child Care Benefit Applicable
Join Now

3 to 5 years old

Tolder room 4 to 5 Days / week
  • 1 Child
  • 10 Hours daycare max per day
  • Child Care Benefit Applicable
Join Now

Online Submission

Register now and we will get back to you soon.

Register Now

item.title: Testimonials
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded:
My daughter went to this daycare for almost two years and she loved it. The teachers are super caring and professional. I would highly recommend this daycare for its wonderful staff. Thank you for making a positive memory for my daughter. Nazanine P.Parent This was fun and exciting working with ages under 3 to age 5. It was a wonderful experience. I loved my work environment. It was a fun place to work even when times were stressful. Very understanding upper management. Love you Dora & Grace. ♥️ Sahba S.Parent My 3 year old daughter attended Dinosaur daycare for a few months, and though we had to switch to a different daycare, she really enjoyed her time there. The staff really care about the kids, and involve them in a variety of fun activities. The little playground as well as the green space they have outside are a great as well. My daughter would play outside (sometimes for an hour!) with other kids, after I'd pick her up at the end of the day. Yuri B.Parent My daughter loved Dinosaur Daycare! The staff are so friendly, accommodating and reasonably priced. We’re sad we’ve moved away! Brooke N.Parent The most loving and caring environment that I could wish for for my son. While the building is older and not the most attractive, the caregivers and teachers are wonderful and very actively involved with all of the children. There are 2 rooms (1-3 year olds) and (3-5 year olds), an indoor gym on the top floor, an outdoor playground and lots of outdoor space to play (fields, forest and lovely walking trails). My son loves Dinosaur Daycare and I know that he feels loved and secure while there. It's a bonus that he is also learning and developing as much as he is, but in a caring environment like that, it makes complete sense. I cannot recommend Dinosaur Daycare enough. Nicole P.Parent Previous Next

©2021 - Dinosaur Daycare - Designed by C&K Agency

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: dinosaur-daycare
item.content:encoded:
About us

We practice the “Three-R” interaction: Respectful, Responsive, Reciprocal. Read More

Covid-19

During the COVID-19 pandemic, Dinosaur Daycare and staff will follow and implement the necessary personal measures. Read More

Our Goal

To provide a safe, secure, nurturing environment in which children will be cared for while away from home. Read More

What “Parents” Say About Us

My daugher went to this daycare for almost two years and she loves it! Nazanine.PParent My daughter attended Dinosaur Daycare for few month, she really enjoyed her time there. Yuri BParent My daughter loved Dinosaur Daycare! The staff are so friendly and accomodating. Brooke NParent The most loving and caring environment that I could wish for my son. Nicole PPARENT

Gallery

Online Submission

Register now and we will get back to you soon. Register Now
